member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.ClaimActionCollectionUniqueExtensions.MapUniqueJsonKey(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OAuth.Claims.ClaimActionCollection,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a top level value from the json user data with the given key name and adds it as a Claim. This no-ops if the ClaimsIdentity already contains a Claim with the given ClaimType. This no-ops if the key is not found or the value is empty.
member.param: The value to use for Claim.Type when creating a Claim.
The top level key to look for in the json user data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.ClaimActionCollectionUniqueExtensions.MapUniqueJsonKey(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OAuth.Claims.ClaimActionCollection,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a top level value from the json user data with the given key name and adds it as a Claim. This no-ops if the ClaimsIdentity already contains a Claim with the given ClaimType. This no-ops if the key is not found or the value is empty.
member.param: The value to use for Claim.Type when creating a Claim.
The top level key to look for in the json user data.
The value to use for Claim.ValueType when creating a Claim.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.Claims.UniqueJsonKeyClaimAction
member.summary: A ClaimAction that selects a top level value from the json user data with the given key name and adds it as a Claim. This no-ops if the ClaimsIdentity already contains a Claim with the given ClaimType. This no-ops if the key is not found or the value is empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.Claims.UniqueJsonKeyClaimAction.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new UniqueJsonKeyClaimAction.
member.param: The value to use for Claim.Type when creating a Claim.
The value to use for Claim.ValueType when creating a Claim.
The top level key to look for in the json user data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext
member.summary: This Context can be used to be informed when an 'AuthorizationCode' is received over the OpenIdConnect protocol.
Creates a

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.JwtSecurityToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the that was received in the authentication response, if any.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.TokenEndpointRequest
member.summary: The request that will be sent to the token endpoint and is available for customization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.Backchannel
member.summary: The configured communication channel to the identity provider for use when making custom requests to the token endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.TokenEndpointResponse
member.summary: If the developer chooses to redeem the code themselves then they can provide the resulting tokens here. This is the same as calling HandleCodeRedemption. If set then the handler will not attempt to redeem the code. An IdToken is required if one had not been previously received in the authorization response. An access token is optional if the handler is to contact the user-info endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.HandledCodeRedemption
member.summary: Indicates if the developer choose to handle (or skip) the code redemption. If true then the handler will not attempt to redeem the code. See HandleCodeRedemption and TokenEndpointResponse.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.HandleCodeRedemption
member.summary: Tells the handler to skip the code redemption process. The developer may have redeemed the code themselves, or decided that the redemption was not required. If tokens were retrieved that are needed for further processing then call one of the overloads that allows providing tokens. An IdToken is required if one had not been previously received in the authorization response. An access token can optionally be provided for the handler to contact the user-info endpoint. Calling this is the same as setting TokenEndpointResponse.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.HandleCodeRedemption(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tells the handler to skip the code redemption process. The developer may have redeemed the code themselves, or decided that the redemption was not required. If tokens were retrieved that are needed for further processing then call one of the overloads that allows providing tokens. An IdToken is required if one had not been previously received in the authorization response. An access token can optionally be provided for the handler to contact the user-info endpoint. Calling this is the same as setting TokenEndpointResponse.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.AuthorizationCodeReceivedContext.HandleCodeRedemption(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectMessage)
member.summary: Tells the handler to skip the code redemption process. The developer may have redeemed the code themselves, or decided that the redemption was not required. If tokens were retrieved that are needed for further processing then call one of the overloads that allows providing tokens. An IdToken is required if one had not been previously received in the authorization response. An access token can optionally be provided for the handler to contact the user-info endpoint. Calling this is the same as setting TokenEndpointResponse.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.MessageReceivedContext.Token
member.summary: Bearer Token. This will give the application an opportunity to retrieve a token from an alternative location.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents
member.summary: Specifies events which the invokes to enable developer control over the authentication process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnAuthenticationFailed
member.summary: Invoked if exceptions are thrown during request processing. The exceptions will be re-thrown after this event unless suppressed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnAuthorizationCodeReceived
member.summary: Invoked after security token validation if an authorization code is present in the protocol message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnMessageReceived
member.summary: Invoked when a protocol message is first received.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnRedirectToIdentityProvider
member.summary: Invoked before redirecting to the identity provider to authenticate. This can be used to set ProtocolMessage.State that will be persisted through the authentication process. The ProtocolMessage can also be used to add or customize parameters sent to the identity provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnRedirectToIdentityProviderForSignOut
member.summary: Invoked before redirecting to the identity provider to sign out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnSignedOutCallbackRedirect
member.summary: Invoked before redirecting to the at the end of a remote sign-out flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnRemoteSignOut
member.summary: Invoked when a request is received on the RemoteSignOutPath.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnTokenResponseReceived
member.summary: Invoked after "authorization code" is redeemed for tokens at the token endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnTokenValidated
member.summary: Invoked when an IdToken has been validated and produced an AuthenticationTicket.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectEvents.OnUserInformationReceived
member.summary: Invoked when user information is retrieved from the UserInfoEndpoint.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.RedirectContext

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.RedirectContext.Handled
member.summary: If true, will skip any default logic for this redirect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.RedirectContext.HandleResponse
member.summary: Skips any default logic for this redirect.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectHandler
member.summary: A per-request authentication handler for the OpenIdConnectAuthenticationMiddleware.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectHandler.Events
member.summary: The handler calls methods on the events which give the application control at certain points where processing is occurring. If it is not provided a default instance is supplied which does nothing when the methods are called.

member.summary: Invoked to process incoming OpenIdConnect messages.

member.summary: Goes to UserInfo endpoint to retrieve additional claims and add any unique claims to the given identity.

The .
The claims principal and identities.
The authentication properties.
member.returns: which is used to determine if the remote authentication was successful.

member.summary: Save the tokens contained in the in the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectHandler.WriteNonceCookie(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the nonce to .
member.param: the nonce to remember.
member.remarks: of is called to add a cookie with the name: 'OpenIdConnectAuthenticationDefaults.Nonce + (nonce)' of . The value of the cookie is: "N".

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectHandler.ReadNonceCookie(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for a matching nonce.
member.param: the nonce that we are looking for.
member.returns: echos 'nonce' if a cookie is found that matches, null otherwise.
member.remarks: Examine of that start with the prefix: 'OpenIdConnectAuthenticationDefaults.Nonce'. of is used to obtain the actual 'nonce'. If the nonce is found, then of is called.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new
member.remarks:
Defaults:
AddNonceToRequest: true.
BackchannelTimeout: 1 minute.
ProtocolValidator: new .
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound: true
ResponseType:
Scope: .
TokenValidationParameters: new with AuthenticationScheme = authenticationScheme.
UseTokenLifetime: false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Validate
member.summary: Check that the options are valid. Should throw an exception if things are not ok.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Authority to use when making OpenIdConnect calls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'client_id'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'client_secret'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration provided directly by the developer. If provided, then MetadataAddress and the Backchannel properties will not be used. This information should not be updated during request processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ConfigurationManager
member.summary: Responsible for retrieving, caching, and refreshing the configuration from metadata. If not provided, then one will be created using the MetadataAddress and Backchannel properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint
member.summary: Boolean to set whether the handler should go to user info endpoint to retrieve additional claims or not after creating an identity from id_token received from token endpoint. The default is 'false'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ClaimActions
member.summary: A collection of claim actions used to select values from the json user data and create Claims.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.RequireHttpsMetadata
member.summary: Gets or sets if HTTPS is required for the metadata address or authority. The default is true. This should be disabled only in development environments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.MetadataAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the discovery endpoint for obtaining metadata

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Events
member.summary: Gets or sets the to notify when processing OpenIdConnect messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.MaxAge
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'max_age'. If set the 'max_age' parameter will be sent with the authentication request. If the identity provider has not actively authenticated the user within the length of time specified, the user will be prompted to re-authenticate. By default no max_age is specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ProtocolValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to ensure that the 'id_token' received is valid per: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDTokenValidation

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.SignedOutCallbackPath
member.summary: The request path within the application's base path where the user agent will be returned after sign out from the identity provider. See post_logout_redirect_uri from http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-session-1_0.html#RedirectionAfterLogout.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.SignedOutRedirectUri
member.summary: The uri where the user agent will be redirected to after application is signed out from the identity provider. The redirect will happen after the SignedOutCallbackPath is invoked.
member.remarks: This URI can be out of the application's domain. By default it points to the root.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound
member.summary: Gets or sets if a metadata refresh should be attempted after a SecurityTokenSignatureKeyNotFoundException. This allows for automatic recovery in the event of a signature key rollover. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to redirect the user agent to the identity provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'resource'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ResponseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'response_mode'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.ResponseType
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'response_type'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Prompt
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'prompt'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.Scope
member.summary: Gets the list of permissions to request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.RemoteSignOutPath
member.summary: Requests received on this path will cause the handler to invoke SignOut using the SignInScheme.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.SignOutScheme
member.summary: The Authentication Scheme to use with SignOut on the SignOutPath. SignInScheme will be used if this is not set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.StateDataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the type used to secure data handled by the handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.StringDataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the type used to secure strings used by the handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.SecurityTokenValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to validate identity tokens.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.TokenValidationParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameters used to validate identity tokens.
member.remarks: Contains the types and definitions required for validating a token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.UseTokenLifetime
member.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is disabled by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.SkipUnrecognizedRequests
member.summary: Indicates if requests to the CallbackPath may also be for other components. If enabled the handler will pass requests through that do not contain OpenIdConnect authentication responses. Disabling this and setting the CallbackPath to a dedicated endpoint may provide better error handling. This is disabled by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.DisableTelemetry
member.summary: Indicates whether telemetry should be disabled. When this feature is enabled, the assembly version of the Microsoft IdentityModel packages is sent to the remote OpenID Connect provider as an authorization/logout request parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectOptions.NonceCookie
member.summary: Determines the settings used to create the nonce cookie before the cookie gets added to the response.
member.remarks: The value of is treated as the prefix to the cookie name, and defaults to .

member.summary: Used to setup defaults for all .

The options instance to configure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectRedirectBehavior.RedirectGet

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectRedirectBehavior.FormPost
member.summary: Emits an HTML form to redirect the user agent to the OpenID Connect provider using a POST request.

member.returns: A reference to this instance after the operation has completed.
